medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began 13 days before admission with a severe headache that developed insidiously, was pounding, and radiated from the occiput to the retro-orbital area and forehead. The onset of pain coincided with visual aura. Symptoms worsened 5 days later, experiencing photophobia, nausea, and vomiting. Five days after discharge from another hospital, lethargy, disorientation, and decreased verbal output developed. Verbal responses to questions were limited to 'yes' and 'no.'
medical_history.past_medical_history: Multiple sclerosis, seronegative inflammatory polyarthritis, migraine, hypertension, depression, anxiety, melanoma, and an episode of sinusitis which resolved 10 weeks before admission. Past surgeries included extended carpal tunnel release of the right wrist and radical flexor tenosynovectomy for inflammatory flexor tenosynovitis.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had coronary artery disease, diabetes, and migraine; father had hypertension, diabetes, atrial fibrillation, and multiple sclerosis.
medical_history.social_history: Married with three school-age children, lived in a suburban community, received disability benefits, spent most time indoors. Smoked 10 cigarettes daily for 7 years but quit 22 years before admission; moderated alcohol consumption; no illicit drug use.
